revised_title: Community-based Distribution: The Future of Contraceptive Social Marketing
tldr: The article discusses the potential and economics of community-based distribution (CBD) of contraceptives through social marketing in developing countries. It highlights the advantages of using commercial marketing techniques to distribute contraceptives at subsidized prices, overcoming the limitations of medical manpower and clinic-based distribution. The author emphasizes the importance of involving the local community in the process of programming and promoting family planning on a continuous basis.
